text: BBC understands that a public health
England is to start recording

suggests people from black Asian and

greater risk of becoming seriously ill
with Kovac 19 is our community affairs

Douglas was an 82 year old pastor and
grandmother from Slough she tested
positive for coronavirus and died in
hospital at the beginning of this month
they called me video called me from the
hospital on the Thursday so I saw her I
prayed with her and prayed for her and
said oh you're looking really strong on
you're gonna come through this I can see
it struggling to breathe but you look
really really well otherwise and very
strong so you know you you will come
through this I was really surprised
shocked to say the least when a few
hours later I was informed that she had
actually passed I did not expect that at
all research shows that people of black
Asian and minority ethnic heritage are
being disappointed by coronavirus only
14% of people in England and Wales are
from these backgrounds yet they
currently make up 34% of patients in
critical care units BBC news analysis
reports in the public domain show almost
three-quarters of 51 health care workers
who have died are from ethnic minority
backgrounds you have a higher proportion
of ba ma population working in key roles
such as transport taxi drivers bus
drivers shopkeepers supermarkets all of
which are necessary in the lockdown
to provide essential services and in

workers while there are many factors

there does appear as you say to be a dis

Riana Crockford BBC News Russian
President Vladimir Putin has warned that
covin 19 continues to pose a high risk
to his country Russia seen it's the
biggest daily increase in the number of
confirmed coronavirus cases up nearly
5,000 from yesterday our Moscow
correspondent Steve Rosenberg has this
report
rarely has Moscow felt so calm so quiet
[Music]
so empty in lockdown a city of 12
million people so peaceful but not
everywhere on the edge of Moscow
ambulances queue outside a hospital
that's treating covert 19 the crews had
to wait more than nine hours to bring in
their patients this is a health system
under pressure
at another facility doctors are
preparing for their shift in the
coronavirus ward with Moscow the
epicenter of the outbreak the hospital
is already over capacity but its head
doctor is used to emergencies he was a
paramedic in Chernobyl the pressure on
us has increased we're getting around
150 new patients every day we're not at
the breaking point yet but we're getting
close
when ghee or ghee got sick with
suspected coronavirus and was struggling
to breathe
twice she called for an ambulance but
none came the system was overloaded when
I did get to hospital it was like
watching an conveyor belt ambulance is
constantly coming in going bringing in
new patients the strain on the system is
close to cut a strophic I decided to go
back home most of the patients were
sicker than me but coronavirus isn't
just a medical challenge it's a
political one too in the 20 years he's
been in power Vladimir Putin has never
faced a challenge of this magnitude a
virus an invisible enemy that's not only
threatening lives but the entire Russian
economy and with it the image mr. Putin
has been keen to cultivate mr. stability
the epidemic has already forced the
president to postpone the annual May 9th
Victory Day Parade on Red Square huge
celebrations for the 75th anniversary of
the end of World War 2 now on hold and
in Moscow the lockdown is tightening to
use a car or public transport you now
need a digital permit the aim to slow
the spread of the virus by keeping more
Muscovites off the streets Steve
Rosenberg BBC news Moscow
